keyword: how many calories in 1 chocolate chip cookie
title: How Many Calories in 1 Chocolate Chip Cookie?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 1 chocolate chip cookie, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 Chocolate Chip Cookie?
assumptions: Medium-sized homemade cookie (~30g), baked with butter, flour, sugar, and semi-sweet chocolate chips; no nuts or fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, and baking method. Check labels for store-bought varieties.

quick_answer.text: One medium chocolate chip cookie contains about 170 kcal, with 8g fat and 22g carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in one chocolate chip cookie?
faqs.a: Approximately 170 kcal for a medium-sized cookie.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a chocolate chip cookie?
faqs.a: About 22g total carbs, including 13g sugars and 1g fiber per cookie.

faqs.q: Is a chocolate chip cookie high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 8g fat per cookie, with 4g saturated fat.

faqs.q: How does cookie size affect calories?
faqs.a: Smaller cookies (~20g) have ~110 kcal; larger ones (~45g) up to 250 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie chocolate chip cookie options?
faqs.a: Yes, tweaks like reducing butter or using oats can lower it to 140 kcal or less.
